poem:
Title: The Morning Paper's Poignant Tale

An ember of regret burns in the morning dew,
The family of Scarlett, draped in sorrow's hue,
Brutal echoes of yesterday's acts,
In 22 years of garnered facts.
Bitter tribute to Brianna's name,
In the end, we all share the same. 
The paper's black ink weeps, tells a story - 
Of murder, remorse, and a punitive quarry.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘Truly sorry’: family of Brianna Ghey murderer pay tribute to mother The family of Scarlett Jenkinson, who was sentenced to a minimum of 22 years for the murder of Brianna Ghey, have said they are “truly sorry” for the teenage killer’s “brutal” actions and paid tribute to Brianna’s family. Jenkinson, described by the judge as the “driving force” behind the murder, was sentenced on Friday for what the Crown Prosecution Service said was “one of". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
